content: My AI assistant suggested adding a semicolon to a Python file. I think it's been hanging out with Java too much.
AI: 'I fixed your bug!' *introduces three new bugs*
Intern: 'ChatGPT wrote my code.' ChatGPT: 'The intern wrote my prompt.'
AI pair programmer: 'I don't think that's optimal.' Me: 'Broâ€¦ YOU wrote it.'
When the AI says 'As an AI language model' you know it's about to refuse to do something fun.
AI apologized for hallucinating. That's how I knew it *really* hallucinated.
Copilot wrote a whole function. I spent 2 hours debugging why it confidently lied.
If your AI recommends using StackOverflow, that's the AI version of giving up.
My AI wrote a joke about itself, then asked for feedback. We're doomed.
